row.column: Overview By using Acumatica Self-Service Portal, you can view all the relevant information about your interactions and perform the relevant activities online. Your User Profile In Self-Service Portal, your personal information is stored, such as your name, organization, email address, phone number, and address. You can view and edit this information any time you need to. You can also view information about your user account and change your password without contacting the portal system administrator. For details, see Your User Profile. User Interface Employees on different positions use different sets of forms in Self-Service Portal to perform their work tasks. You can configure the user interface so that forms you use frequently are at hand. You can configure workspaces in the main menu so that the system displays only frequently used workspaces there. Similarly, you can configure each workspace to which you have access. To the Quick Menu, you can add only forms that you use more often. For more information, see Personalizing the Modern User Interface. Your Company's Account You can update your address information and contact details, and configure and update your company users' access. For more information, see Your Company's Contact Information. The Self-Service Portal also gives you the ability to review information on your customer companies and configure access to the Self-Service Portal for the contact persons. Finance Overview You can easily view the information about your account, check your contracts, or print an invoice yourself. Within Self-Service Portal, you can see all historical documents, balances, due dates, payments received, and amounts due. For more information, see Your Company's Financial Documents. Case Management The Support module gives you the ability to create new support cases, and retrieve the latest case updates any time you want to. For more information, see Case Management. Documentation You can search the knowledge base to find answers to your questions at any time. The Knowledge Base (KB) wiki contains support references, such as information on specific solutions, frequently asked questions (FAQ), and common troubleshooting issues (and their resolutions). Also, other wikis may provide a secure location where you can find documents, such as marketing materials, educational materials, company policies, and surveys. Online Ordering You can use the Orders module to browse the catalog with the offered products, place orders, and track order progress online. For more information, see Managing Online Orders.

row.column: Your User Profile In Acumatica Self-Service Portal, you can view and edit your personal and contact details and the details of your user account. In this topic, you can find information about managing your personal information and your user account. Your Personal Information You can view your personal information, such as your name, position in the company, email address, phone and fax numbers, and address, on the Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SP408045|SP408045]) User Profile (SP408045) form. An employee of your vendor's company has initially entered this information. However, if any of your personal data changes, you can edit this information on your own. Your User Account To access Self-Service Portal, you use your user account. This account contains the following information: your login, password, permissions, and personal settings. You can change your password without contacting the portal system administrator on the ([~/?ScreenId=SP408045|SP408045]) User Profile (SP408045) form. (For details, see To Change Your Password.) On this form, you can also select your time zone, which will be used by the system to define the business date for your sessions. (The default time zone for the business date is specified by the portal system administrator.) ([~/?ScreenId=SP408045|SP408045])

row.column: Personal Settings of the Modern User Interface In the modern user interface of Self-Service Portal, you can specify your personal settings so that the UI better corresponds to your work responsibilities. For a description of the modern user interface, see Modern Self-Service Portal User Interface. In this topic, you will read about the ways the user interface can be personalized. Personal Settings of the Self-Service Portal User Interface You can personalize the user interface of the system as follows: Personalize the list of workspaces shown in the main menu. For details, see Personalization of the Workspace List in the Main Menu Personalization of the Workspace List in the Main Menu. For each workspace, personalize the list of forms and reports shown in the quick menu. For more information, see Personalization of Quick Menu of a Workspace Personalization of Quick Menu of a Workspace. Change the location and size of the main menu. For details, see Changes to the Location and Size of the Main Menu Changes to the Location and Size of the Main Menu. Personalization of the Workspace List in the Main Menu In the modern user interface, the links to forms are organized in workspaces, each of which corresponds to a functional area in the system. The main menu displays menu items corresponding to these workspaces (such as Orders ); you can click any menu item. You can configure the list of workspaces displayed on the main menu panel by pinning and unpinning workspaces. You can pin to the panel only the workspaces that you use in your work frequently. Other workspaces you can access that are unpinned from the panel are hidden under More Items . You can pin and unpin the main menu items any time you need to (for example, when your work responsibilities change). For the steps you perform to pin and unpin a workspace on the main menu panel, see To Pin and Unpin a Workspace on the Main Menu Panel. Personalization of Quick Menu of a Workspace When you click a menu item in the main menu, the system opens the quick menu of the workspace that corresponds to the menu item. You can use this menu to quickly access the forms that you use during your work. You can configure the list of forms in the quick menu for each workspace. We recommend that you display on the quick menu only forms that you use frequently. By clicking the workspace header, you can view the links to all forms of the workspace to which you have access. For a description of how to configure links to forms in the quick menu, see To Configure the Quick Menu Items. Changes to the Location and Size of the Main Menu By default, the main menu is located on the left side of the screen and is displayed in its maximum size. If you need more space in the working area of the screen (for example, to work with forms more conveniently), you can change the location and size of the main menu panel as follows: Collapse the menu panel so that only the icons of menu items are displayed by clicking ( ) in the bottom right corner of the main menu panel. Collapse the menu panel to a button in the top left corner of the screen by clicking ( ) in the bottom left corner of the main menu panel and selecting Collapse to Top . Display only icons on the Menu button and in titles of the main menu items. To do this, you click Menu and then click ( ) in the bottom right corner of the main menu panel. For the procedure that describes how to minimize the menu panel on the screen, see To Minimize the Main Menu Panel.

row.column: Your Company's Financial Documents By using the Acumatica Self-Service Portal, you can keep track of your company account. You can view documents associated with all companies and branches that are available for the tenant, only a particular branch, or only a particular company. Also, you can view the statement history and check the outstanding, overdue, and prepayment balances. Viewing Documents By using the ([~/?ScreenId=SP402000|SP402000]) My Documents (SP402000) form, you can do the following: Check the outstanding and prepayment balances View documents, such as invoices, credit memos, overdue charges, and prepayments, that are associated with any of the following: all companies and branches that are available for the tenant, only a particular branch, or only a particular company, in accordance with the Display Financial Documents setting specified on the Portal Preferences (SP800000) form View and print any document View and print the outstanding balance View and print the outstanding balance broken down by days past due For example, you can review and print an invoice, as described in To Print an Invoice. Viewing Statements On the ([~/?ScreenId=SP404600|SP404600]) My Statements (SP404600) form, you can view the statement history and check the documents included in a selected statement. To open the Customer Statement (AR641500) print form, you need to select the period in which the statements were generated, select the statement, and then click Print Statement on the form toolbar.

To Add a New Contact In Self-Service Portal, you can add contact persons from your organization. As you add contact accounts for these employees, you can give them the ability to enter Self-Service Portal by adding user information to their account, if needed. You use the ([~/?ScreenId=SP408040|SP408040]) Contacts (SP408040) form to add a new contact, as well as to view and edit existing contacts. From this form, you bring up the ([~/?ScreenId=SP408041|SP408041]) Contact (SP408041) form to enter or edit the data of a contact. To Add a New Contact On the main menu, click Support . In the navigation pane, click My Account Contacts . On the form toolbar, click Add New . This opens the ([~/?ScreenId=SP408041|SP408041]) Contact form. Optional: In the Workgroup box of the Summary area, select the workgroup. Optional: Clear the Active check box to make the account temporarily inactive. On the Details tab, enter the contact information of the employee as follows: In the Summary section, enter the employee's name and his or her position in the company. In the Contact section, enter email address, web site, and phone and fax numbers for the employee. Make sure that the email address is valid; it may be used to send the user information, including password recovery details. In the Address section, select the Same As In Account check box to use the company address as the contact address, or enter the address manually if this employee has a different business address. Optional: On the User Info tab, enter the user account information as follows to give this employee the ability to access Self-Service Portal: Optional: In the Time Zone field of the Personal Settings section, select the time zone for the customer contact. The time zone is used to define the business date for this employee when he or she logs in to Self-Service Portal. In the User Type box of the User Information section, select the user type. The user type defines the list of available roles, as well as whether the user account must be activated before it can be used. In the Username box of the User Information section, enter the login name. In the User Information section, do one of the following to give the user a password: Select the Generate Password check box to generate the password automatically; the system will send the login and password to the employee by using the email address you specified in the Email box on the Details tab. Clear the Generate Password check box, and type the password in the Password box. The user will be asked to change the password during the first login. In the Selected column, select the check boxes for the roles the user will be a member of from the list of available roles. A user must have at least one role to get access to Self-Service Portal. If the selected user type requires obligatory activation, click Activate User to activate the user account. On the form toolbar, click Save .

row.PlainText: Managing Contracts Acumatica Self-Service Portal gives you the ability to see the contracts associated with your account and the accounts of your customers, as described in the topics of this section. In This Chapter Contracts OverviewTo View Contract Details

row.column: Contracts Overview A contract represents an agreement between a vendor (the provider of a service) and a customer (the consumer of this service)—and possibly a partner (which might be involved as a reseller). Contracts consist of different combinations of terms and services geared toward the particular needs and capabilities of the organizations involved. For example, a contract may specify that your company will be provided certain services—such as cable TV service, Internet access, or web account hosting—from a vendor during a specified period of time. Other contracts may contain service agreements to maintain and repair a product during the warranty period of the manufacturer or a particular time period. Service contracts often include a number of cases (often called tickets ) that may be solved during a warranty period. A case includes the efforts, such as the work time spent on problem resolution and the related phone calls and emails, to resolve a particular issue. You can view the contracts associated with your company account and the accounts of your partners. For each contract you can check the contract details—including the setup and expiration dates of the contract, the grace period, and the services in the contract—as described in To View Contract Details.

You can use the [HelpRoot_Portal\SP_40_40_00|My Contracts] form to view the available contracts. row.PlainText: Managing Cases Acumatica Self-Service Portal gives you the ability to submit new cases online and then track them. row.column: Case Management Cases (also known as tickets ) are used to record your requests, problems, complaints, and other inquiries. By using the case management in Self-Service Portal, you can submit new cases, change the case priority, enter additional information, get updates on the case status by email, check the case yourself for updates, and view responses to the case. Case Processing Typically, each case goes through stages; the status of a case reflects the stage it is in, as described in the following table. Case Processing Case Status Stage New You submit a new case. Open We work on your case. Pending Customer We await your response. Closed We have resolved and closed your case. When the case is updated, you get an email notification. Also, you can monitor the case by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SP204000|SP204000]) Open Cases (SP204000) form. New Case When you submit a new case, you enter the following information: The case class that defines the default case settings, such as the contract and case attributes. The contract within which the case is processed. For more information about contracts, see Contracts Overview. The case priority, which defines the order of case processing. The case attributes, which depend on the case class. The subject and the description of your case. Supply as much relevant information as possible, so that we will be better able to help you. Any relevant files that you attach to the case. Any additional notes you provide. For the detailed procedure, refer to To Enter a New Case. Case Handling All cases are processed in the order of their priority. When we start working on the case, we change the case status from New to Open . If we change the case status to Pending Customer , this means that we need your input. For example, we may need you to verify that we have achieved the desired result, or we may need additional information. Check the case for details. You can monitor the case status, as described in To View and Edit Case Details. After the case is resolved, you close the case, as described in To Close a Case. Case Closing When you close the case, the case status is left as Open with the reason Pending Closure because we might need to add information to the case before closing it. When we finish working on the case, we set the case status to Closed . Depending on the request, the case can be closed with one of the following reasons: Resolved : You have approved our decision or reply (depending on the initial request). Duplicate : A similar case exists. Canceled : The case has been canceled by the owner. Rejected : We can't process the case for other reasons—for example, because a third-party product is involved. Abandoned : We were unable to resolve the issue because of a lack of response or requested information from the initial owner. You can view the details of closed cases, as described in To Track Closed Cases.

row.PlainText: Managing Online Orders The Orders module of the Acumatica Self-Service Portal gives you the ability to order products online. You can browse the list of products, view detailed product information, place orders, and monitor their progress. In this chapter, you can find the information on how to use the catalog and the shopping cart, and then place and track your orders. In This Chapter Browsing the CatalogUsing The Shopping CartPlacing OrdersTracking OrdersTo Browse the CatalogTo View Item DetailsTo Search for Specific ItemsTo Add Items to Shopping CartTo Change the Contents of the CartTo Clear Your CartTo Proceed to CheckoutTo Copy an Existing OrderTo Track an OrderTo Cancel an OrderTo Track Order Shipments

row.column: You can browse the Self-Service Portal catalog, which contains the list of available products and services. In this topic, you will find information about the catalog. ==Item Availability== The catalog provides information about the available quantities of the products in different warehouses. You can view all the items in the catalog or only the items that are immediately available for ordering. For each available item, you can see the short description and the price. Additionally, if a product is stored in different warehouses, you can select the warehouse you want the product to be shipped from, to minimize shipping costs. For details, see [HelpRoot_Portal\SP__how_Shopping_Browse_by_category|To Browse the Catalog]. ==Item Description== You can view the detailed information about any item from the list by clicking on the inventory ID of the item; this gives you the ability to view its images and extended description. For details, see [HelpRoot_Portal\SP__how_Shopping_Item_details|To View Item Details].((({S:Hint}You can add the required quantity of the item to cart immediately. ))) ==Search for Specific Items== If you are looking for a specific item, you can start typing the item name in the '''Find Item''' box, and the list of items will show you the matching results. If needed, you can select a product category to narrow the search results. For details, see [HelpRoot_Portal\SP__how_Shopping_Search_for_specific_item|To Search for Specific Items].

row.Content: You use the shopping cart to place the items you want to order before you are ready to place the order. ==Adding Items to the Cart== You place the items in your shopping cart before you confirm your order, as described in [HelpRoot_Portal\SP__how_Shopping_Add_to_Cart|To Add Items to Shopping Cart]. Placing Orders After you have reviewed the contents of your cart, you can proceed to place the order. Order Placement When you proceed to checkout, you can review the order details and the shopping information. Recurring Orders If you make similar orders regularly, you can copy the contents of an existing order to a new order, as described in To Copy an Existing Order.

row.column: Tracking Orders After you place an order, you can track the order and the order shipments by using Self-Service Portal. Tracking an Order All the orders placed with your company account are displayed on the ([~/?ScreenId=SP700003|SP700003]) My Orders (SP700003) form. The status of the order reflects the stage of the order processing; contact us to get more information about your company orders. The order may have one of the following statuses: Open : The order is processed, but shipment has not yet occurred. Shipping : At least one shipment for a sales order is confirmed. Click View Shipments to view the shipments and their statuses. For more information, see To Track Order Shipments. On Hold : The order processing has been suspended. Credit Hold : Your account balance has exceeded the credit limit. Back Order : A shortage of items is found and processing of the order may take additional time. Invoiced : One invoice has been generated (or multiple invoices have been generated) for at least one of the order shipments. The invoices are available on the ([~/?ScreenId=SP402000|SP402000]) My Documents (SP402000) form. For more information on printing invoices, see To Print an Invoice. Completed : All invoices have been generated for all related shipments. The invoices are available on the ([~/?ScreenId=SP402000|SP402000]) My Documents (SP402000) form. For more information on printing invoices, see To Print an Invoice. Canceled : The order has been canceled. You may have canceled the order yourself, as described in To Cancel an Order; otherwise, our manager may have canceled it for you; in this case, contact us for additional information. For details about how to track a particular order, see To Track an Order. Canceling an Order You can cancel an order that has not been processed—that is, an order with the Open , On Hold , or On Credit Hold status. For details, see To Cancel an Order. Tracking Shipments You can track the shipments for the orders on the ([~/?ScreenId=SP700003|SP700003]) My Orders form. You select the order, and then click View Shipments to see the shipments associated with the order. The status of the shipment is changed to one of the following as the shipment is processed: Open : The shipment is being prepared—that is, items are being picked and packed. On Hold : The processing of the shipment has been temporarily stopped. Confirmed : The shipment has been confirmed as shipped. Completed : The shipment has been delivered and the invoice has been generated for the system. To print the shipping confirmation, click the shipment number. The shipping confirmation shows the company information (on the top left), the ship-to address of the customer, the required shipping information, and the itemized information about the goods being shipped.

Case Details Form ID: (SP203010) ([~/?ScreenId=SP203010|SP203010])Use this form to view the case details, check the case progress, enter additional information, and close or reopen the case. Form Toolbar The form toolbar includes standard and form-specific buttons. For the list of standard buttons, see Form Toolbar Overview. The form-specific buttons are listed below. Button Description Add Comment or File Opens the ([~/?ScreenId=SP500000|SP500000]) New Comment form and lets you add a comment. The button is unavailable for a closed case. Close Case Closes the selected case. The case status is set to Open , and the reason is set to Pending Closure . This button appears for an open case only. Reopen Reopens the selected case. This button appears temporarily (usually for three months) for a closed case. New Support Case Opens the ([~/?ScreenId=SP203000|SP203000]) New Case (SP203000) form so that you can submit a new case. Summary Area Use the elements in this area to select an existing case for viewing or updating, or to enter general information about a new case. Element Description Case ID The case identifier. Date Reported The date and time when the case was created. Last Activity The date and time of the most recent activity on the case. Subject A description of the case. Class ID The class the case belongs to. Contract The contract that determines how quickly the case should be processed. Assigned to The user the case is assigned to. If a workgroup has been selected, a user name will be selected from its list of group members. Status The status of the case. Reason The reason the case status has changed. Severity The severity level of the case, which is one of the following options: High , Low , Medium . Priority The priority of the case. The following options are available: High , Low , and Medium . Activities Tab This tab has a table with the list of activities associated with the case. When you add a comment, the system displays it in the table. Click any activity to view the contents of the comment in the text (lower) area of the tab. The table toolbar includes only standard buttons. Table Columns Column Description Type The activity type. Subject The brief description of the activity. Date The start date and time of the activity. Created At The date and time when the activity was created. Attributes Tab By using this tab, you can view and update the values for the attributes associated with the case. Attributes are used as additional elements to hold information about the case. The list of available attributes is defined by the case class you selected when entering the case. The table toolbar includes only standard buttons. For the list of standard buttons, see Table Toolbar Overview. Table Columns Column Description Attribute The name of the attribute used for the case. Value The value of the attribute for the case.

Catalog Form ID: (SP700000) ([~/?ScreenId=SP700000|SP700000])On this form, you can browse full list of products and services, view the description of the items, search for the specific items, and add the items you want to buy to your cart. Form Toolbar The form toolbar includes only form-specific buttons as listed below. Button Description Cart Info Displays the quantity of items in your cart and their total cost. Open Cart Opens the ([~/?ScreenId=SP700001|SP700001]) My Cart (SP700001) form that displays the items you added to your cart. Selection Area By using this area, you can search for specific items, filter items by category, show or hide the items that are not available in stock, and monitor the cost of the items you plan to add to your cart. Element Description Find Item Start typing in the box to filter the items whose name or title includes the Category Select a category to view the items of this category. Selection Total Displays the total cost of the items to be added to your cart when you add items to cart. Show Available Items Only Select this check box to view the services and products available in stock. Table By using this table, you can browse the products, view the detailed information about available items and services, and make preliminary selections. When you click on Add to Cart the selected items are added to your cart. Some of the elements of this table may not be available to you. Table Buttons The table toolbar includes standard buttons and buttons specific to this table. For the list of standard buttons, see Table Toolbar Overview. The table-specific buttons are listed below. Column Description Add to Cart Adds to cart the items you marked in the table. Table Columns Column Description Add to Cart The check box you select to mark the item. When you select the item, the total for the item is added to the Selection Total in the Selection area. When you click Add To Cart on the table toolbar, the marked items are added to cart. Qty The quantity of the item to be added to your cart, measured in the units of measure specified in the Unit column. You can change the quantity before you add items to cart. Inventory ID The item available for purchase, by its inventory ID. Click the ID to open the Item Details dialog box to view the detailed description of the item. Description Read-only. A brief description of the item. Price Read-only. The price for a single unit of the item. Unit The unit of measure (UOM) used for the item. You view the available UOM and select the one that suites you the best. Discount Pct, % The percent of the discount based on the line amount or quantity of the line. Discount Amt The discount amount based on the line amount or quantity of the line. Total Read-only. The amount calculated for the item, which is the unit price multiplied by the quantity. Warehouse The warehouse the item is to be shipped from. Double-click on the warehouse to view the available product quantities for each of the available warehouses and select the warehouse from which the product would be shipped. This Warehouse Read-only. The quantity of the product available in the warehouse specified in the Warehouse column. The column is left blank for the available services. All Warehouses Read-only. The quantity of the product available in all warehouses. The column is left blank for the available services. Item Details Dialog Box In this dialog box, the detailed description of the selected item and quickly add the required the item to cart. Element Description Image area Here you can find the images associated with the item. Click the arrows to the right and to the left of the image to view all images. Details table Read-only. Here you can view the attributes of the item. Description area Read-only. Here you can find the detailed description of the item. Order area Here you can immediately add the item to your cart. You just specify the quantity of the item and the warehouse from which the item is to be delivered, and then click Add to Cart .

Checkout Form ID: (SP700002) ([~/?ScreenId=SP700002|SP700002])You use this wizard to complete your order. The checkout process consists of multiple steps, described in detail in sections below: Step 1 Step 1: Enter the shipping information and confirm the order totals Step 2 Step 2: Confirm the order Step 3 Step 3: Print the order Step 1 In this step, you review and, if necessary, change the shipping information. The totals for the order, including the shipping charges and taxes, are calculated in accordance with the shipping information. Form Toolbar The form toolbar includes only form-specific buttons, as listed below. Button Description Continue Click this button to go to Step 2 Step 2 of the wizard to proceed with making your order. Go back to Cart Click this button to go back to ([~/?ScreenId=SP700001|SP700001]) My Cart (SP700001) form to change the order. Return to Shipping Detail Click this button to return to Step 2 Step 2 of the wizard. This button is available only when you returned from Step 2 to Step 1 to correct the order details. Ship-To Info Section In this section, you specify the shipping address. The contact information is used by default. Element Description Location The predefined location where you want the items to be delivered, if any. You can select one of the predefined locations or select the Edit Address check box and enter another address. Edit Address A check box that you select to override the default contact information. Business Name The legal business name of the customer to appear on the documents. Attention The attention line, if one is used in your company's business letters. Phone 1 The primary phone number of your company. Email Your company's email address. Address Line 1 The first line of the billing address. Address Line 2 The second line of the billing address, if any. City The city of your company. Country The two-letter code representing the country of your company; select a code from the predefined list. State The state of your company. Postal Code The postal code. Shipping Information Section Element Description Line Total Read-only. The total amount on all lines of the order. Freight Read-only. The freight amount calculated in accordance with the shipping terms. Tax Total Read-only. The total amount of tax calculated for the order. Order Total Read-only. The total amount of the order. Ship Via The ship via code that stands for the carrier and its service to be used for shipping the ordered goods. Delivery Date The date of the projected delivery. Residential Delivery A check box that you select to indicate that the shipment should be delivered to a residential area. Use Customer's Account A check box that you select to indicate to the system that your company account with the carrier should be billed for the shipping of this order. Ship Complete The way the line items should be shipped. Select one of the following options: Completely : The required quantity should be delivered in one shipment. What's Available : The required items should be delivered in one shipment, but if the requested quantity is not available, the available quantity is shipped and the remainder is canceled. Available and Back Order : The required quantity should be delivered in more than one shipment, with the remainder back-ordered. Comment Your comments and additional notes to the order. Step 2 In this step, you review and confirm the order information, including the order totals, the shipping information, and the items include in the order. Form Toolbar The form toolbar includes only form-specific buttons, as listed below. Button Description Submit Order Click this button to go to Step 3 Step 3 to print your order. Return to Shipping Detail Click this button to return to Step 1 Step 1 to correct the shipping information. Shipping Information Section Element Description Text box This box contains the shipping information: The shipping address The name of the company The carrier The delivery date Totals Section In this section, you can review the order totals. Element Description Cart Total Read-only. The total amount on all lines of the order. Tax Total Read-only. The total amount of tax calculated for the order. Freight Read-only. The freight amount calculated in accordance with the shipping terms. Total Read-only. The total amount of the order. Table In this table, you can review the contents of the order. Column Description Inventory ID Read-only. The unique identifier of the item. Description Read-only. A brief description of the item. Qty The quantity of the item in the cart, measured in the units of measure specified in the Unit column. Price Read-only. The price for a single unit of the specified item. Unit Read-only. The unit of measure of the item. Discount Amt Read-only. The total amount of the discount that has been calculated for the order. Total Read-only. The amount calculated for the item. Step 3 The system generates the sales order as a ready-to-print document. The document provides the company information (in the top left), the ship-to and bill-to addresses, the pertinent shipping information, and the itemized information about goods shipped. You can print the document or export it to file PDF or Microsoft Excel. You can review and print the order on the ([~/?ScreenId=SP700003|SP700003]) My Orders (SP700003) form any time you want to.

These can be used as follows to view cases by user: Select the Me check box to view those cases that you created. Clear the Me check box and select another user to view those cases that the selected user created. Leave the box blank and clear the check box to view the closed cases owned by all of your company's users. Contract The contract associated with the cases to be listed. Table This table includes the list of cases that meet the ownership criteria specified in the Selection area. The table toolbar includes only standard buttons. For the list of standard buttons, see Table Toolbar Overview. Column Description Case ID The case, by its identifier. Subject The description of the case that was provided when the case was reported. Status The status of the case, which is one of the following options: Assigned , Deferred , New , Open , or Waiting . Reason The reason for assigning the case this status. Contract The contract associated with the case. Description The description of the case. Severity The severity level of the case, which is one of the following options: High , Low , Medium . Priority The priority of the case. The following options are available: High , Low , and Medium . Class ID The class the case belongs to. Last Activity The date of the last activity on the case. Contact The user who entered the case. Customer ID The ID of the business account associated with the case.

Contact Form ID: (SP408041) ([~/?ScreenId=SP408041|SP408041])By using this form, you can create a new contact or edit an existing one. You can manage user contact information, enable or disable the contact, add and manage the user account associated with the contact, edit the user's membership in roles, unlock the user account (if the account was locked), and reset the user password. Summary Area In this area, you can create a new contact or select an existing contact for editing. Element Description Contact ID The unique identifier of the contact, which the system generates automatically based on the name information you enter and the courtesy title. When you add a new contact, leave this box blank. Active A check box you select to indicate that the contact is active. Workgroup Optional. The workgroup for the contact. Details Tab This tab contains various information about the contact, with elements grouped into sections to make details easier to find. Summary Section Element Description First Name The contact's courtesy title (which is one of the following options: Dr. , Miss , Mr. , Mrs. , Ms. , or Prof. ) and first name. Last Name The last name of the contact. Position The contact's job title or position. Contact Section Element Description Email The email address of the contact. Web The website of the contact, if any. Phone 1 The primary phone number of the contact. Phone 2 An additional phone number of the contact. Phone 3 Another phone number of the contact. Fax The fax number of the contact. Address Section Element Description Same as in Account A check box that you select to populate the contact's address with the address of the business account. Address Line 1 The first line of the contact's address. Address Line 2 The second line of the contact's address, if any. City The city of the contact's address. Country The country of the contact's address. State The state or province of the contact's address. Postal Code The postal code. View on Map A button that you can click to open the map viewer. User Info Tab Use this tab to create and manage the user account associated with the contact. Personal Settings Table Element Description Time Zone The time zone that is used by the system to define the business date for the selected contact. User Information Section Element Description Status An info box that shows the account status. The following options are available: Not Created : The contact is not associated with any user account. Pending Activation : The new user account is pending activation. Active : The user account is active. Online : The user is signed in to the system. Disabled : The user account is disabled. Temporarily Locked : The user account is temporarily locked out. User Type A user type that defines the roles available to the user and the user account creation rules. Username The user's login name. Password The user's password. This box appears only when you are adding a new user. When you create a new user, you either type the password or select the Generate Password check box. Generate Password A check box you select to have the system generate the password automatically. If you select this check box, the system sends an email with the username and password to the user's email address, which is specified on the Details tab. This check box appears only when you are adding a new user. Reset Password A button that you click to reset the password of the selected user, setting up a new temporary password that the user will be required to change when signing in to the system. When you click this button, a dialog box appears; you should type the password, confirm the password (type it a second time), and click either OK or Cancel .This button is available for only an existing contact for which a user account exists. Activate User A button that you click to activate the new user account if the selected user type requires activation. Enable User A button that you click to enable the selected user account if the user account was disabled. Disable User A button that you click to disable the selected user account. Unlock User A button that you click to unlock the user account if it was temporarily locked. For example, the system locks the user account if the user has entered the password incorrectly three times in a row. Table By using this table, you can assign roles to the user. The list of available roles is defined by the selected user type. A user must have at least one role assigned to gain access to the system. The table toolbar includes only standard buttons. For the list of standard buttons, see Table Toolbar Overview. Element Description Selected A check box that you select to assign the role to the selected user. Role Name The name of the role. Role Description The description of the role.

Contract Form ID: (SP301000) ([~/?ScreenId=SP301000|SP301000])On this form, you can view the details of a particular contract. The contract details are provided for your information only; you cannot edit them. Depending on the contract, you may see some or all of the form elements described below. Contract Info Area In this area, you can select an existing contract and view its primary information. Element Description Contract ID The unique identifier of a contract. Select an ID in this box to view the details of the contract. Contract Template The contract template that was used as a base for the contract. This box appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. Status The status of the contract, which is one of the following options: Draft : The contract has not been activated and cannot be used. Pending Approval : The contract is in the approval process. Pending Activation : The contract is set up and needs to be activated for services to be provided (and recurring billing to be initiated, if required). Active : The contract is activated and should be used as the basis for billing. Expired : The contract has expired and can no longer be used. Canceled : The contract has been canceled and is no longer in use. Pending Upgrade : The contract is being prepared for upgrade. Customer The customer associated with the contract. Description The description of the contract, which includes any related comments. Balance The sum of open invoices associated with the contract. This box appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. Summary Tab You use this tab to view the summary settings of the selected contract. Contract Settings Section Element Description Setup Date The contract setup date. Activation Date The contract activation date. This box appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. Expiration Date The date when the contract expires. Termination Date The date when the contract was canceled, if applicable. Currency The currency to be used for contract billing. Grace Period (in Days) The period of time after the expiration date when services under the contract are provided and the contract can be renewed according to its type. Renew Automatically A check box that indicates (if selected) that the contract is to be renewed automatically. Billing Information Section Element Description Account The specific business account that is to be billed for contract services. Location The customer location associated with the contract. This box appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. Billing Schedule Section This section appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. Element Description Billing Schedule Starts On The start date of the first billing period. Billing Period The type of billing schedule, which can be one of the following options: Week , Month , Quarter , Year , or On Demand . The On Demand option means that billing is not scheduled and the contract can be billed on any date. The invoice date is calculated based on the chosen option and the contract's start date. Last Billing Date The date when the billing was performed most recently. Next Billing Date The date of the next billing invoice according to the billing schedule. Details Tab This tab lists the contract items provided under the contract. Summary Area Elements This area appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. Element Description Effective From The date when the contract was set up. Promo Code The code of any discount to be applied. Pending Setup The sum of prices of the included contract items for setup. The box is displayed for a contract with the Draft or Pending Upgrade status. Pending Recurring The sum of prices of the included contract items that are recurring. The box is displayed for a contract with the Draft or Pending Upgrade status. Pending Renewal The sum of prices of the included contract items for renewal. The box is displayed for a contract with the Draft or Pending Upgrade status. Total Pending The total amount of pending contract items. The box is displayed for a contract with the Draft or Pending Upgrade status. Current Setup The sum of prices of the included contract items for setup. The box is populated with a sum on contract activation. Current Recurring The sum of prices of the included contract items that are recurring. The box is populated with a sum on contract activation. Current Renewal The sum of prices of the included contract items for renewal. The box is populated with a sum on contract activation. The table toolbar includes only standard buttons. For the list of standard buttons, see Table Toolbar Overview. Column Description Item Code The identifier of the contract item. Description A description of the item, with any relevant comments. Included The quantity of this contract item that is included by default. Difference The quantity difference in case of contract upgrade or downgrade. This box appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. Setup Price The contract item price for setup. This box appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. Setup Discount, % The discount percent applied to the setup price. This box appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. Recurring Price The contract item recurring price. This box appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. Recurring Discount, % The discount percent applied to the recurring price. This box appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. Renewal Price The contract item price for renewal. This box appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. Renewal Discount, % The discount percent applied to the renewal price. This box appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. Recurring Summary Tab This tab lists contract items that have the recurring price configured. This tab appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. The table toolbar includes only standard buttons. For the list of standard buttons, see Table Toolbar Overview. Summary Area Elements Element Description Recurring Total The total sum to be billed during the current billing period. Extra Usage Total The total sum to be billed for extra usage during the current billing period. Total Due The total amount to be billed during the current billing period. The table toolbar includes only standard buttons. For the list of standard buttons, see Table Toolbar Overview. Column Description Item Code The identifier of the contract item. Description A description of the item, with any relevant comments. Inventory ID The identifier of the non-stock item a customer is billed for on a recurrent basis. Sales Unit The unit of measure used for billing. Billing Type The item billing policy of the contract item. Included The item quantity that is billed for at the recurring price. Recurring Price The recurring price of the item. Recurring Discount, % The discount percent applied to the recurring price. Extra Usage Price The item quantity that the customer is billed for at the extra usage price. Used The item quantity used during the current billing period. Used Total The item quantity used from contract activation through current business date. Contract History Tab The tab displays a list of actions performed during the duration of the contract. This tab appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. The table toolbar includes only standard buttons. For the list of standard buttons, see Table Toolbar Overview. Column Description Action The action that was performed. Date The date when the action was performed. User The user who performed the action. Related Contract The identifier of the related contract, if applicable. A related contract is either one that derived from the current contract or one that served as a source for the current contract. AR History Tab The tab, which displays the list of documents related to the contract, appears for the customer whose account is billed for contract services. The table toolbar includes only standard buttons. For the list of standard buttons, see Table Toolbar Overview. Table Columns Column Description Type The type of Accounts Receivable document. Reference Nbr. The reference number of the document. Click the reference number to open the document for printing. Date The date of the document. Due Date The due date of the document. Status The status of the document. Amount The amount of the document. Balance The balance of the invoice, if it has been partially paid. Payment Method The default payment method for the customer.

My Documents Form ID: (SP402000) ([~/?ScreenId=SP402000|SP402000])On this form, you can check your company's current balance and prepayment balance and track all the documents associated with your company. All amounts are displayed in the base currency of the vendor. Form Toolbar The form toolbar includes standard and form-specific buttons. For the list of standard buttons, see Form Toolbar Overview. The form-specific buttons are listed below. Button Description Oustanding Invoice/Memo Opens the Invoice/Memo (AR641000) report for the selected document. By using this form you can print the document in the PDF or HTML format. Print Account History Opens the AR Balance by Customer (AR632500) report with the following parameters: Report Format is set to All Documents Include Applications is cleared The report displays the outstanding balance of your company during the current financial period. The documents are grouped by account–subaccount pair and listed by reference number. You can easily see each document’s dates, original amount, and balance after payment application. If your account has child accounts for which the Consolidate Balance check box selected, then the system displays the report with the Consolidate Data by Parent Account check box selected. You can view consolidated information about balances of customer accounts involved in a parent-child relationship. The system will display balance details for only your account along with the consolidated balance of the group. Aging Report Opens the AR Aged Past Due (AR631000) report that displays your company's outstanding balance broken down by days past due. The system uses the current date when calculating the aging categories for the documents. All the amounts are shown in the base currency. If your account has child accounts for which the Consolidate Balance check box selected, then the system displays the report with the Group by Parent Account check box selected. You can view consolidated balance of the group. Summary Area You use the elements in this area to view outstanding and credit balances as well as available credit. Element Description Outstanding Invoices and Memos A read-only box that displays the outstanding balance of your company (sum of open invoices, credit and debit memos, and overdue charges). Unapplied Payments A read-only box that displays the balance of your company's open payments (sum of unapplied payments and prepayments). Net Balance A read-only box that displays the total balance of all open documents associated with your company including the total balance of prepayments. Credit Limit A read-only box that displays the credit limit that is set for your company. Available Credit A read-only box that displays the credit limit that is not used regarding the current balance of your company. Table This table contains the list of documents associated with your company. The table toolbar includes only standard buttons. For the list of standard buttons, see Table Overview. Column Description Type The document type. Reference Number The document reference number, as assigned by our company. Date The date when the document was created. Due Date The date when payment for the document is due. Status The status of the document. Document Total The original amount of the document (before payment application). Open Balance The balance of the document, if a payment was applied. Description The description of the document. Customer The customer account associated with the document. The column is hidden by default and it is mainly used to distinguish documents of a child account.

Portal Preferences Form ID: (SP800000) ([~/?ScreenId=SP800000|SP800000])You use this form to configure your company's Self-Service Portal instance. You select the company or branch that the portal user can access, set up the default case settings, select the email templates for automatic mailing, and configure the online ordering. You access this form by signing in to your Self-Service Portal instance with a user account that has the Administrator or Portal Admin role assigned. Form Toolbar The form toolbar includes only standard buttons. For the list of standard buttons, see Form Toolbar Overview. General Settings Tab You use this tab to select the branch of the organization to which the customers would have limited access. Additionally, on this tab, you select the default options for new cases and the templates for automatic emails. Portal Settings Section Element Description Portal Name A brief description of the portal. Display Financial Documents A setting for restricting the visibility of financial documents on the My Documents (SP402000), My Statements (SP404600), and My Orders (SP700003) forms and the visibility of reports that may be opened from these forms, such as Invoice/Memo (AR641000), AR Balance by Customer (AR632500), and AR Aged Past Due (AR631000). This setting also affects the Outstanding Invoices and Memos , Unapplied Payments , and Net Balance amounts on the My Documents form. The following options are available: From All Companies and Branches : The portal user can see documents associated with any company and branch set up in the system. From Company : The portal user can see documents associated with a particular company and its branches. From Branch : The portal user can see documents associated with a particular branch. Portal Site Company The company whose documents a portal user may see. This box appears if the From Company option is selected in the Display Financial Documents box. Portal Site Branch The branch whose documents a portal user may see. This box appears if the From Branch option is selected in the Display Financial Documents box. For details about selecting the tenant the Self-Service Portal has to be connected to in a multitenant configuration, see To Specify the Company Available for Self-Service Portal in the Acumatica ERP Installation Guide. Home Page The portal home page. The following options are available: Company node (that is, the top node of the tree): The Self-Service Portal dashboard is used as the home page. Wiki article : The article you select in the tree is used as the home page. Blank : The default Welcome article is used as the home page. For more information, see the Self-Service Portal > Managing Self-Service Portal Home Page topic in the Acumatica ERP Portal Administration Guide. CRM Settings Section This section is available if the Case Management on Portal feature is enabled on the Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form in Acumatica ERP. You use the elements in this section to select the defaults for new cases entered through the Self-Service Portal. Element Description Default Case Class The case class assigned to a new case by default. Priority The default case priority. The following options are available: Low , Medium , and High . Case Activity Notification Template The template that is used to send notifications to the case owner about changes customers made to their cases. Default Contact Class The contact class assigned to a new contact by default. Email Preferences Section In this section, you select the template that will be used for sending automatic emails. Element Description Portal External Access Link The URL that will be included in the emails sent to new users and the login and password recovery emails if the user account is marked as a guest account . This setting is also available on the Site Preferences (SM200505) form in Acumatica ERP. B2B Ordering Settings Tab The tab is available if the B2B Ordering feature is enabled on the Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form in Acumatica ERP. On this tab, you configure the default settings for the online ordering feature of the Self-Service Portal. You select the warehouses from which the customers can order your company's products and the default warehouses, select the default sales order type, decide if the customers will be able to view the quantities of items in stock, and upload a default image for the items in the catalog. Main Settings Section Element Description Default Branch for New Orders The branch to be associated by default with new sales orders created from Acumatica Self-Service Portal. If this setting is modified, the customer cart on the My Cart (SP700001) form becomes cleared for all customers. If the From Branch option is selected in the Display Financial Documents box on the General Settings tab of this form, the branch specified in the Portal Site Branch box on that tab is automatically specified in this box, which becomes non-editable. Sales Order Type The type of sales order that will be generated when the customer makes an order. By default, the system uses the SO order type. Default Subitem The default subitem to be used when an order is placed by using Self-Service Portal. The subitem can be changed later when you open the order in Acumatica ERP. Default Stock Item Warehouse The warehouse from which the stock items will be ordered by default. Default Non-Stock Item Warehouse The warehouse from which the non-stock items will be ordered by default. Show Available Quantities A check box that you select to show the quantity of items left in stock. Allow Only Sales Unit for Purchases A check box you select so that the customer can order items in only the unit of measure used as a sales units for the inventory item. Default Image Settings You use this section to upload default images to be shown when an item in the catalog doesn't have an image attached. To upload an image, drag it to the Image area or click Browse to select an image, and then click Upload to upload the selected image. After you have uploaded the images, click Save on the form toolbar to save the changes. Element Description Browse A button you click to select an image you want to upload. Upload A button you click to upload the selected image. Image The small version of the uploaded image that is used as a default image. Click on the image to see the large version of the image. If you upload multiple images, the image that is displayed when you click Save on the form toolbar is used by default. To browse images, click on the arrows under the image. Table In this table, you can see the list of warehouses available in your organization. By default, a customer can view the items from all the warehouses. To prohibit customer access to a warehouse, clear the Include in Warehouses List check box in that row. Element Description Warehouse ID The identifier of the warehouse. Description The description of the warehouse. Include in Warehouses List A check box that indicates (if selected) that the warehouse is available for customers on the Catalog (SP700000) form. Branch The branch with which the warehouse is associated. Company The company with which the warehouse is associated.

This article describes how to start and finish using Self-Service Portal. ==Signing In== To start using Self-Service Portal, you need to sign in. To do so, perform these steps:[anchor|#ol_kw5_flr_d3] #Open your browser. #In the Address bar, type the URL of the Self-Service Portal instance and press Enter. This opens the Welcome screen. #In the '''Username''' and '''Password''' boxes, type your user name and password, respectively. #Optional: In the '''Interface Language''' box, select the interface language you want to use. #Click '''Sign In'''.
==Forgotten Password or User Name== If you have forgotten your password, follow these instructions to recover it:[anchor|#ol_bfr_kbs_d3] #On the Welcome screen, click '''Forgot your password or username?'''. #On the '''Password recovery''' screen, type your user name in the '''Enter your username''' box. #Click '''Submit'''. #Check your email for further instructions. #In the email, click the password recovery link. #:This opens the Welcome screen for changing your password. #In the '''New Password''' and '''Confirm Password''' boxes, type your new password. #Click '''Sign In'''.
If you have forgotten your user name, follow these steps to recover it:[anchor|#ol_rrg_1cs_d3] #On the Welcome screen, click '''Forgot your password or username?'''. #On the''' Password recovery''' screen, click '''Forgot your username?'''. #On the '''User recovery''' screen, type your email address in the '''Enter your email address''' box. #Click '''Submit'''. #Check your email for an email that contains your user name. Signing In and Signing Out This article describes how to start and finish using Self-Service Portal. Signing In To start using Self-Service Portal, you need to sign in. To do so, perform these steps: Open your browser. In the Address bar, type the URL of the Self-Service Portal instance and press Enter. This opens the Welcome screen. In the Username and Password boxes, type your user name and password, respectively. Optional: In the Interface Language box, select the interface language you want to use. Click Sign In . Forgotten Password or User Name If you have forgotten your password, follow these instructions to recover it: On the Welcome screen, click Forgot your password or username? . On the Password recovery screen, type your user name in the Enter your username box. Click Submit . Check your email for further instructions. In the email, click the password recovery link. This opens the Welcome screen for changing your password. In the New Password and Confirm Password boxes, type your new password. Click Sign In . If you have forgotten your user name, follow these steps to recover it: On the Welcome screen, click Forgot your password or username? . On the Password recovery screen, click Forgot your username? . On the User recovery screen, type your email address in the Enter your email address box. Click Submit . Check your email for an email that contains your user name. Signing Out When you have finished using Self-Service Portal, remember to sign out to prevent unauthorized users from tampering with the system or your account. If you are inactive for more than one hour, you will be automatically signed out. To sign out of the system, do the following: In the info area (in the upper-right corner of the screen), click your user name and click Sign Out .

row.PlainText: Modern Self-Service Portal User Interface In the modern user interface of Self-Service Portal, existing elements were redesigned and new elements are introduced, which provide you with enhanced visualization and flexibility in configuring the navigation items. The modern user interface makes your work in the system convenient and easy because you can configure it to better fit your working tasks. This chapter describes the new and redesigned elements of the user interface. row.column: Basic Elements of the Modern UI Every Self-Service Portal screen includes basic elements that users use for navigating the system, viewing and managing data, and performing other basic functions. The following screenshot shows a typical Self-Service Portal screen in the modern user interface with the basic elements that appear on it. Basic elements of the modern UI Home button Search box Info area Main menu (displayed as a panel) Working area Home Button When you click the Home button, which has the Acumatica logo on it by default and is located in the top left corner of the Self-Service Portal screen, you are forwarded to the home page of your instance. If the main menu is minimized the Home button is displayed to the left of the Info area. Search Box By using the Search box on the top pane of the Self-Service Portal screen, you can search for a text string in menu items, form titles, help topics, files, notes, and entities created using system forms, such as vendors and cases. Additionally, you can search for a form by its title and ID. For details, see Search in the Modern UI. Info Area The info area, in the upper-right corner of the Self-Service Portal screen, contains the menus and buttons that you can use to sign out from the system, change the settings of your account, and view the business date. For more information, see Info Area in the Modern UI. Main Menu The main menu in Self-Service Portal contains the links to your favorites and workspaces (menus with links to forms). By default, the main menu is a panel located on the left side of the Self-Service Portal screen. You can minimize the menu so that it is displayed as a button in the top left corner of the screen (instead of the Home button). For details, see Main Menu in the Modern UI. When you click a workspace item on the main menu, the workspace menu opens. This menu contains the forms dedicated to a particular functional area. For details, see Workspaces in the Modern UI. Working Area The working area, which is the large area on the right side of the screen, may display any of the following: Form: Self-Service Portal has forms of multiple types. For more information, see Form Overview. The Welcome dashboard: On this dashboard, usually, you can see introductory information about capabilities of the portal. The dashboard is configured by the organization which hosts Self-Service Portal.

Info Area in the Modern UI The info area, in the right corner of the top pane on the Self-Service Portal screen in the modern user interface, includes a group of menus and buttons, as shown in the screenshot below. These menus and buttons communicate the status of your user account in the system and provide access to certain settings. Info area Business date and time Help button User menu button You can find more details about these items in the following sections. Business Date and Time Business date is used as the default date on Self-Service Portal forms and on documents that you create by using the forms. Business date and time, which you can see in the Info area, is specified in an Acumatica ERP instance to which Self-Service Portal is connected. You cannot change the business date and time on Self-Service Portal. Help Button By clicking the Help button, you can open the Help menu, which overlaps the working area. The content of this menu depends on the item displayed in the working area when you click this button. For a detailed description of Help capabilities in Self-Service Portal, see Help in the Modern UI. User Menu The User menu button displays your first and last name (last name first, with the names separated by a comma) and the name of the company to which you signed in if multiple companies are configured in your Self-Service Portal instance. The following screenshot shows the items of the User menu. Items of the User menu The User menu includes the following sections: Companies My Profile Sign-In The Companies section of the User menu contains the list of companies to which you can sign in if multiple companies are configured in your Self-Service Portal instance. The company you are currently signed in to is indicated with a check mark. You can switch to a different company by clicking the company name. The My Profile section contains your user name, your email address, and the My Profile button, which you click to open the ([~/?ScreenId=SP408045|SP408045]) User Profile (SP408045) form. For more information about the settings of your profile, see Managing Your User Profile. The Sign-In section contains the date and time of your last sign-in to the system and the Sign Out button, which you click to sign out of the system.

Searching on Self-Service Portal gives you the ability to quickly open a form (or a record on a form), find a file, or find a help topic. This topic contains information on performing searches in the modern user interface of Self-Service Portal.{br}{TOC} ==Search Form== To begin a search, you type a text string in the '''Search''' box. The system opens the Search form in the working area, on top of the page (such as a dashboard or a form) that was opened when you started your search. The form is shown in the following screenshot.[anchor|#_fd80c30e-fd23-4ab4-b4b2-bbf3e77dce35][anchor|#_4fba661a-862a-4d70-a27f-fc090c6dab12][image:Portal/Images/SP_UIG_New_UI_Search_Results.png|popup|Search form|450px][anchor|#_dfcac0ff-0aeb-4371-accb-a10189e67933] #Search filter tabs #Search results
You can look through the search results on the Search form and go back to the page you had opened before you performed the search. For example, you can start to enter data on some Self-Service Portal form, search for some information, and then go back to the form and continue to enter data because your previous changes have been preserved. ==Search Filter Tabs== By default, the search in Self-Service Portal is performed in form titles. You can switch to one of the search filter tabs to change the scope of the search. The following tabs are available:[anchor|#ul_yx2_jsg_g3] *'''Menu Items''': On this tab, you can scan for specific forms by name or ID. *'''Transactions and Profiles''': On this tab, you can look for specific system records, such as customers, vendors, prospects, employee accounts, and notes attached to records. *'''Help and Support''': This tab lists search results in all guides and help topics. When you click a link to a Help topic, the topic is opened in a separate tab of a browser. If you want to open the Help topic over the working area, you should press Ctrl and click the link. *'''Files''': On this tab, you can view files attached to system records.
When you type a text string in the '''Search''' box and switch between the search filter tabs, your text string is preserved, and search results are automatically displayed for this text string. ==Search Results== In Self-Service Portal, an intelligent search is implemented. The system performs a flexible search, considering all possible forms of the text string that you have entered in the '''Search''' box, and then lists the search results from the most relevant to the least relevant.{br}
The system narrows the search results based on the access rights of the user who performs the search. If you don’t have permissive access rights to particular data (such as contracts), these objects do not appear in the search results, even though they match the search criteria. Your access rights to file attachments are determined by your rights to the entities to which the files are attached. ==Search Tips== Keep the following tips in mind when you use the search capabilities on Self-Service Portal:[anchor|#ul_lmf_hn3_zq] *To search for all possible forms of a particular word or phrase, you type it as is without any additional characters. For example, if you type ''invoice'' in the '''Search''' box, the system displays all strings that contain ''invoice'', ''invoices'', and ''invoiced''. *To search for an exact match of a particular word or phrase, you enclose it in quotation marks. For example, if you type ''“Western Star Trucks”'' in the '''Search''' box, the system returns only the customer with this exact name. *To search for a particular string everywhere in the system (in form titles, help topics, system entities, and files), you type the string in the '''Search''' box and then switch to each of the filtering tabs.
